channel.title: Case number of this?
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/mk936v.png[/img]
Im trying to add right click rest emote and i cant seem to find the case number of it? lol.. it might sound nooby but help?

item.title: Case number of this?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

First, nowhere in this topic did you mention that you had already solved this. The last thing you posted was

yesimanub:

:o… can someone post the rest orbs method :o

Second, if you are referring to your topic here, then you created a new topic, for a problem that is directly related to this topic (double posted). Instead, you should have stated in this thread that you solved the initial problem, but are now having a new problem.

It is not our job to piece together your topics spread across the section, in order to ascertain what you mean.

Read full topic

item.title: Case number of this?
item.dc:creator: @yesimanub yesimanub
item.description:
@yesimanub wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:469411”][quote author=yesimanub link=topic=586605.msg4164485#msg4164485 date=1353530724]
:o… can someone post the rest orbs method :o
[/quote]

No. We’re not here to spoonfeed you.

Also, if you haven’t tested it yet (like you said in your previous post) then why are you posting here? Test first, and if it doesn’t work, and you’ve tested it in different ways, then post here, with what you’ve tested, and your results.

The packet necessary is probably just an Interface interaction packet (“clicking buttons”). If it’s not telling you which unhandled packet it is, write the code for the system to print a line to the console saying what “button” id it is.[/quote]

if you would look in the help section you would see i posted another help thread saying i already completed this… and the other thread also states that i made a code myself. IF you would just look before flaming your ass on me

Read full topic

item.title: Case number of this?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

yesimanub:

:o… can someone post the rest orbs method :o

No. We’re not here to spoonfeed you.

Also, if you haven’t tested it yet (like you said in your previous post) then why are you posting here? Test first, and if it doesn’t work, and you’ve tested it in different ways, then post here, with what you’ve tested, and your results.

The packet necessary is probably just an Interface interaction packet (“clicking buttons”). If it’s not telling you which unhandled packet it is, write the code for the system to print a line to the console saying what “button” id it is.

Read full topic
